metadata.title: CVE-2019-16781 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
In WordPress before 5.3.1, authenticated users with lower privileges (like contributors) can inject JavaScript code in the block editor, which is executed within the dashboard. It can lead to an admin opening the affected post in the editor leading to XSS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16781` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentytwo - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.2+dfsg1-1').
